title: Verifying Backend receipt of Registration
custom_preconds:
**Preparing your device**
1. Uninstall any existing HBO builds on the device.
2. Log out of Android accounts.
Navigate to device Settings > Accounts, then select current account and logout/deregister.
custom_steps:
**Whitelisting your account**
1. Using Google.com, create a test email.
2. Contact the Android HBO Project Manager and have them add your test email to the list of testers for the app.
- **Note** It takes up to 3 hours for the email to be whitelisted. So wait at least 3 hours to test with this email (A whitelisted email will not bill a credit card during testing).
3. Add a valid credit card to the Google Wallet. If you contact Elizabeth Addis, she can add a credit card to the account.

**Install and Register**
1. On the Google Device, login to the device using your Google Whitelisted email address.
2. Contact the Android PM and have them send the current IAP LAT build (Connect device build. Not Mobile).
3. Install the build.
4. Go to APPS on your Google Device.
9. Locate the HBO NOW app.
10. Starting the app will bring you to the Paywall
11. At the Paywall, start the IAP flow by selecting “Start Your Free Trial”
12. Select “Subscribe” from the app store dialog
13. Complete the standard Google store purchase flow
14. Upon completion, You will receive a confirmation email from HBO and a link to complete user registration. 
- **NOTE: If you are testing in the QA environment** - when you click the registration completion link in the email, the URL will be https://www.hbonow.com/register-profile... **Change the "www" to "qa"** and refresh the site.
15. Finally complete the HBO NOW user registration.
custom_expected:
- Account registration e-mail will be received.
- User will be able to initiate video playback on device when logged into the new account.
- Backend devs will verify the registration e-mail appears in the appropriate Database

title: MAIN MENU to CONTINUE WATCHING page transition
custom_preconds:
The user has installed HBO Now
And signed in with valid account
And has previously selected an asset
And has started to watch the asset but not to completion before quitting the app
And has Settings: Continue Watching set to ON
custom_steps:
At HBO Now Main/Home navigation screen (Home navigation menu displays at left of screen)
Press d-pad left
custom_expected:
The Large “Continue Watching” Tile: moves onto the screen from the left, aligning it’s left edge with the left “margin” 

Main Menu: moves from the left to right, coming to rest— still partially visible—on the right side of the screen

(if more than 1 item is in the Continue Watching list, it is hinted at- at the left edge of the screen.


The “Continue Watching” (CW) content should appear to exist to the “left” of the Main Menu content. The intent is to give the user the impression that they can always access CW by hitting “left” from the Main Menu.

title: Default Page Transitions
custom_preconds:
Pages that are subject to custom animations, are done so primarily to communicate a sense of physical “location” to the user, thereby making content traversal via directional input a more intuitive experience.

Pages that are not subject to custom animations should use default animations to fade in and out of pages and NEVER appear to blink on or off screen.
custom_steps:
Navigating the following page transitions: 

 - FireTV Home to HBO Now app Start-up
 - Main Menu to Search
 - Search to Main Menu
 - Main Menu to Settings
 - Settings to Main Menu
 - Subcategory to Asset Detail
 - Asset Detail to Subcategory
 - Asset Detail to Video player
 - Video playback to Asset Detail
custom_expected:
Default transition between pages should be a fade-in/fadeout scenario. 
There is no expectation for motion to be present in default transitions, however it’s expected that deliberate control over the position, duration
and curve specifications for each view element (title, season nav, asset details, etc…) will be applied.
